description:
In a lonely corner of the world, on the edge of No Man’s Land, sits Clocktower Fortress. It’s home to the 1121st Platoon of the Helvetian Army, and their newest member is a 15-year-old volunteer named Kanata Sorami, who enlisted to learn how to play the bugle. When she was a child, Kanata was saved by a beautiful soldier and found inspiration in the clear, golden sound of her trumpet. From that day forward, Kanata decided music would be her life.

As the other platoon members train her how to be a bugler and a soldier, Kanata's enduring optimism will inspire them to look for happiness and beauty, even in a world haunted by war.

(Source: Right Stuf, Inc.)

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Steampunk
tags.description: Prominently features technology and designs inspired by 19th-century industrial steam-powered machinery.

tags.name: Iyashikei
tags.description: Primary aim is to heal the audience through serene depictions of characters' daily lives.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Nun
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a nun.

tags.name: Tanks
tags.description: Prominently features the use of tanks or other armoured vehicles.

tags.name: Language Barrier
tags.description: A barrier to communication between people who are unable to speak a common language.

name.native: フィリシア・ハイデマン
イリア・アルカディア

node.description:
__Height:__ 165 cm

[Website](https://www.tomatsuharuka.com/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/tomatsuharuka-blog)

Tomatsu debuted in 2007, starring in Shinkyoku Soukai Polyphonica as Corticarte Apa Lagranges. Since then, she has had other major roles such as Lala Satalin Deviluke in To Love-Ru and Shiho Sannomiya in Zettai Karen Children. Before graduating from high school in 2008, she used to live in Ichimomiya city where she often took the shinkansen, traveling back and forth between Nagoya and Tokyo to attend recordings. On January 11, 2019, she married a man from outside the entertainment industry.

One of the members of the voice actress unit [Sphere](https://anilist.co/staff/103636).

__Non-anime roles:__
- Mary - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)

[Website](http://www.michiru-oshima.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/OshimaMichiru) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/6zqZlqpjrq3op255dF32Fr?autoplay=true)

She is a composer who has worked on several video game, movie, and television titles. Her works include composition for the video games Ico for PlayStation 2, Arc the Lad III, and an orchestral arrangement of a Zelda medley for the Wii and Gamecube game The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess. In addition to video game music, she has composed music for the Godzilla movies and scores for numerous anime television series, including Fullmetal Alchemist (and the motion picure Fullmetal Alchemist the Movie: Conqueror of Shamballa), Queen Emeraldas and Bounen no Xamdou. She was also the composer for a Japanese stage musical adaptation of the classic Hollywood film Roman Holiday.

Ooshima graduated from the Kunitachi College of Music, Department of Music Composition. Afterwards she began her activities as a composer and arranger while in college, and has been involved in making music for movies, commercials, TV programs, animated features, and ambient music. While in college, she released a symphony entitled "Orasho". Through her masterful manipulation of both orchestras and synthesizers, she has attracted attention from various sectors for creating grandiose, dramatic sounds and beautiful melodies. Her awards include the Mainichi Film Contest Award for Best Music, and the 21st, 24th, 26th, 27th, 29th and 30th Japanese Academy Award for Music, and Jackson Hole Film Festival 2007(USA) Best Composer Award.

After graduating from Miyakojima Technical Senior High School, Kanbe moved to Tokyo and went to a Professional Training College while delivering newspapers to maintain himself. He joined Studio [Topcraft](https://anilist.co/studio/363/Topcraft) and as his first job he worked as production assistant on [Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind](https://anilist.co/anime/572/Nausica-of-the-Valley-of-the-Wind/).

In the late '80s and early '90s he worked on several NHK educational anime for children while he had his debut as director with the OVA [Ninja Ryuukenden](https://anilist.co/anime/619/Ninja-Ryuukenden/) in 1991. 

In 1997 he established Studio Garan with several employees of [Studio Junio](https://anilist.co/studio/280/Studio-Junio) (which he had previously joined). Garan was one of the subcontracting studios for [Cardcaptor Sakura](https://anilist.co/anime/232/Cardcaptor-Sakura/) and the episodes Kanbe directed garnered much attention. He left Garan in 2000.

More recently he's been mainly known for directing psychological and thriller anime like [Elfen Lied](https://anilist.co/anime/226/Elfen-Lied/), [Electromagnetic Girlfriend](https://anilist.co/anime/5177/Electromagnetic-Girlfriend/) and [The Promised Neverland](https://anilist.co/anime/101759/The-Promised-Neverland/).

[Official Website](http://www.kalafina.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kalafina_staff) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCnRbD__LEKBj_ZR_dC8KmzQ)

Kalafina were a Japanese band formed by composer [Yuki Kajiura](https://anilist.co/staff/100077/Yuki-Kajiura) in 2007 to mainly perform theme songs for the [Kara no Kyoukai](https://anilist.co/anime/2593/Kara-no-Kyoukai-Fukan-Fuukei/) anime movies, but since expanded to many other theme songs for other anime shows and films.

Main vocals and backgrounds are provided by a different member each time. For example, Wakana is in charge of the main vocals in Oblivious and Lacrimosa, while the main vocals in Aria are done by Hikaru. In others songs each of them sings a stanza. Wakana and Keiko are also members of Yuki Kajiura's [FictionJunction](https://anilist.co/staff/103691/FictionJunction) project. 

Spacecraft agency officially announced disbandment on March 13, 2019 after Kajiura, Keiko, and Hikaru left the agency in 2018.

In January 2025, the three members will reunite for the first time in six years to hold "Kalafina Anniversary LIVE 2025" at the Tokyo Garden Theater, with Takebe Satoshi serving as musical director.

__Members:__
• [Yuki Kajiura](https://anilist.co/staff/100077/) (梶浦由記) - Composer

• Keiko - [Keiko Kubota](https://anilist.co/staff/104664/) (窪田啓子/ケイコ) - Vocalist
• Wakana - Wakana Ootaki (大滝若奈/ワカナ) - Vocalist
• Hikaru - [Hikaru Masai](https://anilist.co/staff/168857/) (政井光/ヒカル) - Vocalist

• Maya Toyoshima (豊島摩耶) - Vocalist, participated only in "ARIA"/"sprinter", left the group in 2009

__Support:__
• Remi Tanaka (田中玲美/REMI) - Background vocalist
• [Yuriko Kaida](https://anilist.co/staff/103489/) (貝田由里子) - Background vocalist
• Hanae Tomaru (戸丸華江) - Background vocalist

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岡真里子)

Originating from Studio Live. Notable works as a character designer include [Jigoku Shoujo](https://anilist.co/anime/228/), [Ghost Hound](https://anilist.co/anime/2596/) and [Nurarihyon no Mago](https://anilist.co/anime/7592/). Close friends with [Hiroshi Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/101189/), and often designs the characters for the shows which he directs.

__Hiroyuki Yoshino__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

Since the beginning of his career he has been working with Studio Sunrise, he has scripted various of its anime including [Mai-HIME](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/), [Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Hangyaku-no-Lelouch) and [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/99/MaiOtome/).

Upon graduating from the Waseda University's School of Literature, he went on to become a teacher of world history at a high school. After this, Hiroyuki joined the staff of Tokuma Shoten's Animage magazine as a writer. It was in this magazine that the Sunrise producer Furusato Naotake offered him a position in the studio as a screenwriter.

Since joining Studio Sunrise, the first series in which he was the head-writer, as well as the series composer, was the series Mai-HIME, followed-up by [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/) and [Mai-Otome Zwei](https://anilist.co/anime/1609/MaiOtome-Zwei/). He also went on to supervise, as an extension to this work. Hiroyuki has also authored the manga adaption of [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/manga/31069/MaiOtome/) (alongside Tatsuhito Higuchi), and went on to write numerous other manga series.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mellco)

Illustrator mainly for light novels who first debuted in 2004.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/johnsama) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/75255)

Noted for his work in the [Sword Art Online](https://anilist.co/anime/11757/) franchise.

Married to fellow animator [Haruko Iizuka](https://anilist.co/staff/105678/).

**Date of Birth:** ?? ??, 1976
**Birthplace:** Chiba Prefecture, Japan

**Takahiro Ikezoe** is a Japanese animator, director, episode director and storyboard artist.
